law.catch_line: Issuance of policies in other states.
law.text: A domestic insurer duly authorized to transact insurance in another jurisdiction may issue policies for delivery in such jurisdiction pursuant to applications for insurance solicited and obtained therein, in accordance with the laws thereof, subject only to such restrictions, if any, as may be contained in the insurer's charter or bylaws.
law.history: Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 301, subtit. 24, sec. 34, effective June 18, 1970.
